entries.meaning: (nautical) A tank ship, a vessel used to transport large quantities of liquid.
(automotive, UK) A fuel tanker, petrol tanker, road tanker.
(aviation, usually military) An aircraft carrying a large supply of jet fuel or avgas for aerial refueling of other aircraft, plus equipment allowing the in-air transfer of fuel.
examples: Without the KC-46 tankers orbiting in friendly airspace, our fighters would've run out of fuel long before reaching the combat zone.

entries.meaning: (aviation, firefighting) An aircraft built or modified to carry water and/or fire retardant for dropping on wildfires.
examples: While our ground teams cut firebreaks in the brush, the tankers kept the fire in the mountains at bay with frequent drops of water and retardant.

entries.meaning: (military) Member of a tank crew, or of an armoured unit.

examples: I swung the tanker around just in time to take off with the lip.

verbs.description: tanker (third-person singular simple present tankers, present participle tankering, simple past and past participle tankered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To transport (oil, etc.) in a tanker.
(aviation) To carry more fuel than necessary for a flight, in order to avoid having to refuel at a destination where fuel is more expensive or in short supply.
